summary: The Equitable Access to School Facilities Act aims to support the creation and expansion of state policies to improve the quality, affordability, and access to facilities for charter schools. It authorizes grants to states for establishing or enhancing charter school facilities aid programs. The bill amends sections of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to address funding allotments, facilities financing, and state aid programs. It also provides for technical assistance, research, and dissemination related to charter school facilities and programs, and authorizes appropriations over several fiscal years. The act prioritizes increased access to facilities funding, public buildings, and facilities in low-income and rural communities.
